place.name: STAPLEFORD
place.gazetteerText: STAPLEFORD, a parish in the district of Newark and county of Lincoln; on the river Witham, 6 miles ENE of Newark r. station. Post town, Newark. Acres, 2,930. Real property, £2,282. Pop., 204. Houses, 36. The manor belongs to Lord Middleton. The living is a vicarage, annexed to Carlton-le-Moorland. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
